node.title: COVID-19 case confirmed at Goondiwindi on Queensland's southern border
node.alt: Small flower garden and parked cars in the main street of Goondiwindi.
node.description: Queensland Health confirms a person has tested positive to COVID-19 in Goondiwindi in the state's southern border region, but currently consider the case as "very low risk".
node.content:
["Queensland Health has confirmed a person has tested positive to COVID-19 in Goondiwindi\u00a0in the state\u2019s southern border region.\u00a0", "Authorities are investigating the case, including undertaking genomic sequence testing, but currently consider\u00a0the case as \"very low risk\".\u00a0", "The person is currently being taken to a COVID-19 hospital in south-east Queensland.", "It has been eight days since Queensland last recorded a locally-acquired COVID-19 case. \u00a0\u00a0", "At this stage, Queensland Health is still investigating if the case is connected to a truck driver who spent time in the town earlier this week, before later testing positive while in New South Wales.\u00a0", "The truck driver was in the community on Sunday and Monday, visiting several locations, including the BP Truckstop, Coles and Kmart.\u00a0", "Local authorities said a public health alert had been issued.", "Goondiwindi is a town of about 6,000 people on the Queensland-New South Wales border.", "The region's mayor, Lawrence Springborg, said in a statement that health authorities were working\u00a0to identify and notify any close contacts, as well as exposure sites,\u00a0as they became available.", "\"I understand Darling Downs Health is investigating the potential for community transmission and that some of the close contacts from this confirmed case are already in isolation,\" he said.", "\"We can take comfort in the fact that the Goondiwindi region has the highest vaccination rate in the state.", "\"At 81.5 per cent fully vaccinated [as of 31 October 2021], our community has done all it can do to prepare and I am confident that this will serve us well.\"", "", "
Mayor Lawrence Springborg says\u00a0the town can\u00a0take comfort in the fact the Goondiwindi region has the highest double-vaccination rate in the state.(ABC News: Stephen Cavenagh)
", "Mr Springborg said that, as a precaution, he had asked council staff to limit interactions with others.", "\"[I] would encourage others to do the same until we have a better picture of the situation at hand,\" he said.", "\"I want to encourage everyone who enters our community \u2014 from whatever side of the border \u2014 to please make sure you do the right thing to protect our community and get vaccinated as soon as possible if you haven't done so already.\"", "Further details on the case are expected to be provided at tomorrow\u2019s daily COVID-19 update.\u00a0", "", "
Outbreak: How Australia lost control of the Delta variant
"]
